neutral: ^… Did the address include this much about myself before?
yes: ^Mr. President, I come with good news.
^You found it. Many, many thanks, good sir.
^… Hm, this looks different from what I remember. It’s no matter. Please, take these fruits. It’s the least I can do.
^Watermelons, apples, starfruit… This is a lot.
^The local farmers gave me quite the haul, but I cannot take this much from the people. It’ll be in better hands with you.
no: ^Good day, President Lincoln. The weather is… good.
^Yes, I do agree but it may not be one I can enjoy. I apologize if this is sudden but, you see… I lost my copy of the Gettysburg Address.
^I must agree and I would appreciate any help. I can only hope it’s located soon, because the Declaration of Independence--
^(I’m not sitting through this.) What does it begin with?
^Ah, yes. It should begin with… “Four score and seven years ago our fathers brought forth…”
^If you find it, please let me know.
